message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The staining procedure described is the acid-fast staining method, which is used to identify organisms with mycolic acid in their cell walls, such as Nocardia asteroides. Rickettsia rickettsii is an obligate intracellular bacterium, Cryptococcus neoformans is a fungus, and Staphylococcus aureus does not have mycolic acid in its cell wall, so they would not show up as red organisms in acid-fast staining.

Among the options, only nocardia is an acid-fast organism. Rickettsia rickettsii is a Gram-negative bacteria that causes Rocky Mountain spotted fever and is identified by Giemsa stain. Cryptococcus neoformans is a yeast that causes cryptococcosis and is identified by India ink stain. Staphylococcus aureus is a Gram-positive bacteria that commonly causes skin infections and is identified by Gram stain.
